discover.instruction: Read about recent news. Notice how we describe things that happened recently.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай о недавних новостях. Обрати внимание, как мы описываем недавние события.

content.text: Breaking news! A famous actor <highlight>has just announced</highlight> his retirement. The president <highlight>has recently met</highlight> with world leaders. Scientists <highlight>have just discovered</highlight> a new planet. Tech company <highlight>has already released</highlight> a new smartphone. I <highlight>have just finished</highlight> reading the article. <highlight>Have</highlight> you <highlight>heard</highlight> the news <highlight>yet</highlight>? The team <highlight>hasn't arrived</highlight> <highlight>yet</highlight>. They <highlight>have already left</highlight> the airport.
content.question: What words show that these events happened recently?
content.question_ru: Какие слова показывают, что события произошли недавно?

theory.title: Present Perfect for Recent Events with just/already/yet
theory.title_ru: Present Perfect для недавних событий с just/already/yet

points.example: I have just eaten. (a few minutes ago)

points.rule_ru: yet = до сих пор (вопросы и отрицания)
points.example: Have you finished yet? I haven't started yet.
I have recently started a new job. Have you seen any good movies lately?

points.rule: Word order: have/has + just/already + V3; yet at the end
points.rule_ru: Порядок слов: have/has + just/already + V3; yet в конце
points.example: I have just arrived. Have you eaten yet?

notice.instruction: Find all Present Perfect verbs with just/already/yet. What's the difference in meaning?
notice.instruction_ru: Найди все глаголы в Present Perfect с just/already/yet. Какая разница в значении?

tasks.text: Mom: Have you done your homework yet? Son: I have just started it. Mom: What? You haven't finished it yet? Your sister has already done hers! Son: She has just left for her friend's house. Mom: Has she cleaned her room yet? Son: Yes, she has already cleaned it. I haven't had time yet! Mom: I have just made dinner. Come and eat first, then finish your homework. Son: I have already eaten at Tom's house. Mom: You have recently been spending a lot of time there!

notice.reflection_question: Can we use 'already' in questions? Can we use 'yet' in positive sentences?
notice.reflection_question_ru: Можно ли использовать 'already' в вопросах? Можно ли использовать 'yet' в положительных предложениях?

exercises.instruction: Complete with Present Perfect and just/already/yet.

sentences.sentence: We ___ recently ___ (move) to a new apartment.

questions.sentence: She has ___ left, so you won't find her.

sentences.incorrect: I have finished just my work.
sentences.correct: I have just finished my work.

sentences.incorrect: Have you yet called your mother?
sentences.correct: Have you called your mother yet?

sentences.explanation: Already comes between has and V3

produce.instruction: Write about recent events in your life or the news.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши о недавних событиях в твоей жизни или в новостях.
prompts: What have you just done today?
What have you already accomplished this week?
What haven't you done yet but plan to?
What interesting news have you heard recently?
produce.example: Today has been a busy day! I have just finished a big project at work. I have already sent it to my boss. I haven't received a reply yet, but I hope she likes it. I have recently started learning to cook. I have just made my first pasta from scratch! My friend has already tried it and said it was delicious. Have you tried any new hobbies lately? I haven't had time for exercise yet this week, but I plan to go running tomorrow.
criteria: Mix of positive, negative, and questions

texts.title: Morning Rush
texts.content: I have just woken up and I'm already late! I haven't had breakfast yet. I have just realized I have a meeting in 30 minutes. Have you ever had mornings like this? My alarm has already rung three times. I haven't showered yet. I have just found my car keys. I have already missed the bus. Has the taxi arrived yet? I have just called one!

texts.title: Project Update
texts.content: Manager: How is the project going? Employee: We have just completed the first phase. Manager: Already? That's impressive! Employee: Yes, but we haven't started the testing yet. Manager: Have the clients seen it yet? Employee: They have just received the preview. Manager: Has anyone found any problems yet? Employee: Not yet, but we have recently added new features. We have already fixed the bugs from last week. Manager: You have just made my day!

texts.title: Travel Plans
texts.content: We have just booked our vacation! We have already chosen the hotel. Have you ever been to Greece? We haven't decided the dates yet. My husband has recently gotten time off work. I have already started packing! He says I have just bought too many clothes. We haven't told the kids yet - it's a surprise! Have the flights gotten cheaper yet? I haven't checked lately.

texts.title: Breaking News
texts.content: Breaking: Scientists have just made an incredible discovery! They have recently found evidence of water on Mars. This news has already spread around the world. Have you heard about it yet? Experts have just confirmed the findings. The space agency has already announced a new mission. They haven't revealed all the details yet. This has just become the biggest story of the year! Have you ever imagined life on other planets? Dreams have just become closer to reality!

texts.title: Restaurant Rush
texts.content: The restaurant has just opened and it's already busy! We have just seated 20 customers. Have the orders gone to the kitchen yet? The chef has already started cooking. We haven't received the delivery yet. The fish has just arrived - finally! Has table 5 gotten their drinks yet? No, they have just ordered. I have already checked on them twice. Have we run out of anything yet? Not yet, thankfully!

grammar_cards.front: She has ___ done it. (sooner than expected)

Find the error:
"I have yet not finished."
grammar_cards.back:
I haven't finished yet.

yet at the end

Yes, I have just eaten.

just before V3
